history.content:
Unless you are already very close to getting into 168 from the waitlist I doubt you will get in. 168 is about the Internet and design decisions and 186 is about databases. Your choice would depend on what interests you more and what type of internships you would like to pursue. In regards to workload, it would really depend on how you feel with many techs: I've always taken 3 together and found it manageable, as long as they are reasonable techs. I didn't take 54 (took 16ab) but if it resembles 16ab, it should be easier for most parts because it is slower paced. Then, best predictor for how you will do on 170 is how you felt in 70 and how comfortable you feel with the most mathy parts of 61b (complexity for example). Now, talking about the startup, I guess it really depends on what is your role. Anyway I think you'll be fine with taking either as long as you put in the work

---------------------

I haven't taken 168 yet so I can't speak to the workload for that class, but I do know that 186 has been significantly revamped in workload since when I took it in Fall 2016, so that's something to consider since 170 is a heavy workload class. However, if you can handle the weekly problem sets in 170 (ranging from 4-10 hours based on your strength in math/proofs) and the problem sets in 54 (~2 hours each set iirc), you should be fine regardless of what class you choose.

If your focus right now is heavily on interviews and internships/jobs, I'd highly recommend 186 over 168. From my own internship experience I have found that database knowledge is used more frequently in general SWE positions. I haven't really received an interview questions in either databases or networks, but I have gotten the vibe that databases knowledge is something that is generally expected while networks knowledge is more if your position requires heavy work with networks. Both topics can be self-learned, though, but if you want to take the more "relevant" course between the two, I'd go for 186.

Unless you are already very close to getting into 168 from the waitlist I doubt you will get in. 168 is about the Internet and design decisions and 186 is about databases. Your choice would depend on what interests you more and what type of internships you would like to pursue. In regards to workload, it would really depend on how you feel with many techs: I've always taken 3 together and found it manageable, as long as they are reasonable techs. I didn't take 54 (took 16ab) but if it resembles 16ab, it should be easier for most parts because it is slower paced. Then, best predictor for how you will do on 170 is how you felt in 70 and how comfortable you feel with the most mathy parts of 61b (complexity for example). Now, talking about the startup, I guess it really depends on what is your role. Anyway I think you'll be fine with taking either as long as you put in the work

children.subject: You know yourself the best, but personally I think that's a lot. Like I said, 186 has increased in workload over the past few semesters, 170 is already a big weekly time commitment, and 54 adds a bit to that. 168, while generally known to be one of the lighter workload upper divs, is still probably a decent amount of time commitment as it is a CS upper div.
if I didn't do the startup class, do you think 186,170,168, and math 54 would be too much?

history.content:
Trying to decide what to pair with cs 170, math 54, and a startup accelerator in the fall. 

I am just curious how 186 and 168 compare, in relevance to interviews/Jobs/future classes/workload.
history.subject: Cs 186 vs cs 168: how do they compare in workload and relevance?
